ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned sooooo many new perspectives on drone warfare, AI, data processing, area studies, facial recognition, etc an endless list of current and important topics! Very new to this but one of my most interesting and engaging courses.
I really enjoyed this class and I learned a lot
a very broad theoretical understanding of how digital technology interacts with militarism and colonialism, as well as tactics for resisance!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Lots of time for discussion and in depth analysis of new topic each week. Absolutely loved it.
This course was amazing! It was very unique compared to any other course Ive taken at Yale and I enjoyed our conversations every week!
I found the class very interesting and I think I learned a lot

The strengths of the course was the emphasis on student discussion and sharing your own point of view. While I learnt a great amount from listening to my classmates speaks, I wish more time could have been spent on hearing the professor's voice and having her lead the discussion a little bit more than just the student leaders.

i really liked the weekly reading responses, they definitely kept me accountable in doing the work for the seminar. the final project was also super flexible and i definitely got a lot out of it! everyone's final papers were also really diverse, and learning about this new field was definitely insightful. since the material was super new everyone was really interested in the topics and very engaged in class discussions.

i do think we wasted WAY too much time going over each other's paper outlines for the midterm, as prof tahir required as to (it took up basically 3 weeks, which i think could've been used for discussion). one solution if this course is offered next semester is a graded group peer review i think.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would take this so many times! Great in or out of major
100%! Interesting material, great assignments, and amazing Professor!
Yes! I think this is a very important class to take to learn more about the Middle East and the potential future consequences of technology, as well as what is happening right now
Yes, especially if you are looking to "de - Americanise" your perspective on Digital War. However, if you are not interested in this particular field, I would advise against taking this course.
yes! especially if you're interested in the more digital technology aspects of fsts. a lot of discussions we had in class were so so necessary in the age of unchecked tech innovation.
